attributes.action: Change the rules regarding piercings on female and males of school pupils
attributes.additional_details: Having facial piercings does not effect there education in any way teenagers express them selfs this way, they get punished or excluded have anxiety attacks as there asked to take them out, it’s not fair the rules should change.
attributes.background: I want the rules for schools to change regarding piercings, facial, ears. Pupils express them selfs in different ways and with the stress of “trying to fit in” and viruses, and other troubles that they have to deal with daily.

rejection.details:
The UK Government does not set rules about student appearance. This is a matter for individual schools.

We have accepted the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ban mandatory uniforms in state schools: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550875

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban schools from setting any rules about student appearance, if that is what you want to happen.
